nodes.bodyText: can you help fixing this by adding "_" to the prefix? Thanks!
fix
Please add JavaDoc for this constructor
Added JavaDoc
A bit messy, can you re-organize? Probably using help of parenthesis
reorganized this part.

Added JavaDoc, capitalized class name.
Keep this class name as "SchemaAnnotationHandlerUtil"
Updated the other one to "SchemaAnnotationHandlerClassUtil", since that one is used to get schema annotation handler class names.
I feel manual test for these is not enough. Can you find a way to write test cases for this line of logic?

Adding test cases is not that straight forward. There are multiple validations in this method. If we only want to test this specific logic, it is hard to generate extensionSchemaFields. Why do you think manual test is not enough? I tested following scenarios:

extension schema field with @extension
extension schema field without any annotation
extension schema field with annotation but not with "extension" namespace
multiple extension schema fields, some of them with validate annotation, some of them without validate annotation.
In your case, should we reword to "annotation validation" instead of "annotation processing"?
Updated log.
From my experience, exception won't be enough, you probably will  have to add "Error" as well
Updated to - catch (Exception | Error e)
{ to newline :)
fixed

Use pdl?
We would have to migrate PDSCs in pegasus that are used to represent entities like ResourceSchema etc. We can do it after you merge this PR..
I am going to use pdl for this schema.
Specified only for one to many...

nodes.bodyText:
I'm thinking we should move ResoureKey annotation definition also here: https://jarvis.corp.linkedin.com/codesearch/result/?path=resource-identity%2Fresource-identity-urn%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fpegasus%2Fcom%2Flinkedin%2Fresourceidentity%2Furn&reponame=multiproducts%2Fresource-identity&name=ResourceKey.pdl
As this annotation itself doesn't provide all details needed for the injection. It would be good to keep them both in one place. What do you think?
We can do it in a follow-up PR.

nodes.bodyText: Why is this duplicated? Can't you just use SchemaAnnotationHandlerClassUtil?

This utility is getting SchemaAnnotationHandler list, it is in the restli-tools module. So that the SchemaAnnoationValidatorCmdLineApp could use SchemeAnnotationHandler objects. SchemaAnnotationHandlerClassUtil is in gradle-plugin module, it is used to get handler class names(String). Based on the current structure of pegasus gradle tasks, we cannot pass the Object(SchemaAnnotationHandler) from gradle-plugin task to the restli-tools main class, correct me if I am wrong.
I don't think you need this class, you should be able to add the handlerJarPaths to the classpath of the javaExec and the just use the default class loader to load the classes.

@karthikbalasub Actually, I am not using schemaAnnotationHandler for this validation.
I think I'd better remove all those 2 Utils and keep the code as before, because it is unrelated to this change.
Why only typerefs? Wouldn't checking for resourceKey annotation be enough?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,11 +50,24 @@
 import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
 
 
+/**
+ * This class is used to validate extension schema, the validation covers following parts:
+ * 1. The extension schema is a validate schema.
+ * 2. The extension schema's fields should only be annotated by "extension" namespace.
+ * 3. The extension schema's fields annotations should be {@link ExtensionSchemaAnnotation}.
+ * 4. The extension schema's field's schema should only be typeRef or array of typeRef.

nodes.bodyText: Based on LinkedIn TypedUrn concept, check resourceKey annotation should be good enough. I will update the logic here.
